title: Liverpool's 'ghost goal' specialist Luis Garcia reckons Emre Can's shot v Southampton crossed the line
text:
Sport Liverpool's 'ghost goal' specialist Luis Garcia reckons Emre Can's shot v Southampton crossed the line The Spaniard knows a thing or two about shots creeping over the line at the Kop end, and on Wednesday night he'd seen enough Share He knows a thing or two about this sort of thing... (Photo: Reuters/Getty Images) Share Get Liverpool FC     
If only they'd had goalline technology back in 2005, eh? 
If they did, then we'd know for certain whether or not Luis Garcia's famous "ghost goal" for Liverpool against Chelsea in the Champions League semi-final was over the line or not. 
Reds fans always maintain that it was - and of course it was the goal which took Liverpool to the Istanbul final where they famously beat AC Milan - but Chelsea supporters (and many other fans) remain unconvinced. Over the line or not? (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) Luis has seen enough (Photo: Getty) 
But it seems as though the man who scored it has now declared himself the authority on Liverpool efforts which creep slowly towards the Kop end goalline. 
Because when Emre Can's effort against Southampton in the EFL Cup semi-final on Wednesday was spilled by Fraser Forster, and then clawed away from the line by the goalkeeper, he'd seen enough. Emre Can takes aim, and Fraser Forster spills... (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) But just about gets away with it (Photo: Reuters) 
It didn't matter that goalline technology later ruled that it wasn't a goal, to Garcia it was. 
And he took to Twitter to tell everyone. 
Maybe Liverpool should think about getting rid of goalline tech at the Kop end and just let Garcia decide?
